question: SwachhSwasthSarvatra is a joint initiative of the:
option1: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation
option2: Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change and Ministry of Urban Development
option3: Ministry of Urban Development and Ministry of Rural Development
option4: Ministry of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation and Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers
answer: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation
explanation:
SwachhSwasthSarvatra is a joint initiative of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation. The scheme aims to achieve open defecation free India by 2019, and create a deep impact on the health outcome of the country. The three key components of SwachhSwasthSarvatra are:
  • Community Health Centers (CHCs) in ODF blocks supported to achieve Kayakalp certification
  • Gram Panchayat of Kayakalp Primary Health Centers prioritized to become ODF
  • Training in WASH (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) of CHC/PHC nominees
